programme.title: Wildest Africa: Madagascar: Islands of Monsters
programme.desc: Madagascar is truly a weird and wonderful land. Isolated on an island of extreme and magical looking locations, life has adapted and diversified. With few predators, numbers have proliferated and natural selection has gone mad.

programme.title: Wildest Islands: Caribbean: The Wild Side of Paradise
programme.desc: The Caribbean is a tropical paradise. From just a few meters wide, to hundreds of kilometers across, each of the over 7,000 islands are different, and each has its own unique wildlife.

programme.title: Wildest Latin America: Amazon: One Jungle, Many Worlds
programme.desc: The Amazon is the largest rainforest in the world, and the richest ecosystem on earth. This film uncovers what makes the Amazon such a powerhouse of evolution; how it has come to home a third of all species on the planet.

programme.title: Wildest Islands: Falkland Islands: Penguin Paradise
programme.desc: The Falkland's bleak, battered, and windswept archipelago lies 460 km from the South American mainland. Rugged mountains and expansive pristine coastline are a unique home for wildlife  especially for one of the world's most iconic flightless birds.

programme.title: Wildest Indochina: Vietnam: Phoenix from the Ashes
programme.desc: Around 10% of the world's species live in Vietnam, with tropical jungles fit to burst with wildlife. But less than 50 years ago, things were very different. During the war, Vietnam's forests were decimated, but as it always does, life fought back.

programme.title: Prince Valiant
programme.desc: In a time now lost in the mists of memory, the great King Arthur rules in the legendary citadel that is Camelot. Starring: Joanna Lumley, Stephen Moyer, Katherine Heigl, Thomas Kretschmann

programme.title: In Time
programme.desc: Justin Timberlake and Amanda Seyfried co-star in this sci-fi thriller set in a future world where aging stops at 25, and the only way for one man to stay alive is to steal more time.

programme.title: War (2007)
programme.desc: A full-throttle, martial arts thriller, WAR stars Jet Li and Jason Statham as two adversaries set on a violent collision course in the Asian mob underground.

programme.title: Blood Waters of Dr. Z
programme.desc: Seeking revenge against those responsible for stripping him of his tenure and the denial of human research subjects, Dr. Z mutates himself into a hideous — and murderous — half-human-half-fish-like creature!

programme.title: Ring of Terror
programme.desc: A medical student (played by George B. Mather) is tormented by a frat-house hazing after being asked to remove a ring from the finger of a corpse.

programme.title: Attack of the Giant Leeches
programme.desc: Hillbilllies, holo-clowns and a giant leech named Patches abound when Joel and the Bots take on this bloodsucking tale from director, Roger Corman.

programme.title: The Violent Years
programme.desc: Jam Handy shows the world the glory of sexism with electric kitchen appliances and Ed Wood analyzes the world of criminals spoiled by their parents.

programme.title: Crime Investigation Australia: Buried Alive: Luckman and Reid

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters
programme.desc: Running low on petrol, Stevie (Simmone Jade Mackinnon) and Terry (John Jarratt) stop at a decrepit truckstop run by an old drunk named Ken Logan (Harold Hopkins).

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters
programme.desc: Tess (Bridie Carter) has some extra feed on her hands, having inadvertently over-ordered. She gives it to Nick (Myles Pollard) and Alex (Aaron Jeffery).

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters
programme.desc: Jodi and Stevie are not getting on well, with Jodi fed up at what she sees as Stevie’s unnecessary risky behaviour.

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters
programme.desc: While excitedly preparing for Charlotte’s first birthday party, Tess receives a process server from Peter Johnson, Charlotte’s biological father, demanding custody. Distressed, Tess calls on the Ryans for help.

programme.title: Ghost Hunters: Roasts and Ghosts

programme.title: Paranormal State: The Devil in Syracuse
programme.desc: The clients are new, but the spirit is all too familiar as Ryan Buell prepares himself to battle the taunting demon that has been following him.

programme.desc: PRS travels to Shapleigh, Maine where a woman and her daughter are reporting attacks from a winged creature with sharp teeth. Psychic Chip Coffey arrives and senses a half-human, half animal presence.

programme.desc: Paula and her husband Mike are under siege by a purported shadow demon in their North Carolina home. Paula has witnessed a toddler bed levitating and heard deep growls. Michelle, Ryan and the team uncover the shocking truth behind the haunting.

programme.title: Paranormal State: Do Bad Things
programme.desc: After receiving a letter requesting PRS' help, Ryan and the team head to Ohio to help a grieving family and determine if the family's house contributed to the untimely death of a daughter.

programme.title: Most Haunted: Unseen: Bron-Y-Garth Hospital Pt1
programme.desc: Stuart ventures into Bron-Y-Garth, an old workhouse and abandoned hospital. The spirits that reside here are said to be plentiful, something Stuart finds out all to soon.

programme.title: Most Haunted: Unseen: Bron-Y-Garth Hospital Pt2
programme.desc: Karl takes on the formidable cell block of Bron-Y-Garth, a former workhouse and abandoned hospital. The dark corridors are said to house many an aggressive entity, and soon Karl finds out first-hand what it they capable of in a climactic end.

programme.title: Most Haunted: Unseen: Doncaster Air Museum Pt1
programme.desc: The famous Air Museum in Doncaster houses many an artefact of aviation history and many spirit from its past. Karl investigates one of the huts that is said to be full of paranormal happenings, and he isn’t disappointed.

programme.title: Most Haunted: Unseen: Doncaster Air Museum Pt2
programme.desc: The main hanger of Doncaster Air Museum is a vast building and houses flying aircraft of every kind. Stuart ventures alone and soon realises something is there with him.

programme.title: Most Haunted: Unseen: Nunnington Hall Pt1
programme.desc: Karl investigates the upper floors of this large manor house that is said to be swarming with paranormal activity of every kind, and gets more than he bargained for.

programme.title: Most Haunted: Unseen: Nunnington Hall Pt2
programme.desc: The creaky corridors and old rooms of Nunnington Hall have many stories of ghosts and phantoms, Stuart investigates the middle floors and starts to experience unexplained happenings.

programme.title: Most Haunted: Unseen: Shrewsbury Prison Pt1

programme.title: Most Haunted: Unseen: Shrewsbury Prison Pt2
programme.desc: With Yvette and Mary investigating A-Wing, Karl & Stuart take on the formidable C-Wing where the unhappy spirits of past residents are said to roam.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven: Thoroughbreds - Part 2
programme.desc: Jonathan and Mark try to help Lizzie. The new bride has cancer and she is pregnant.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven: A Song for Jason - Part 1
programme.desc: Mark and Jonathan become counselors at a camp for children with cancer.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven: A Song for Jason - Part 2
programme.desc: Jonathan and Mark are helping patients at Camp Good Times in different ways. But a father still refuses to deal with his son's illness.

programme.title: Wild At Heart: Episode 9

programme.title: Wild At Heart: Episode 10
programme.desc: Du Plessis is restless after his heart surgery but the family insist he needs to relax. Meanwhile Danny and Alice are happy to have closed down a zoo down that has been mistreating animals.

programme.title: Wild At Heart: Episode 1
programme.desc: While on honeymoon in London, Alice discovers that Danny has some final business to do before they can return home to Africa. He's reluctantly arranged to meet his estranged father, Robert, who has recently got back in touch.

programme.title: Wild At Heart: Episode 2
programme.desc: Danny is throwing himself into his work after the death of his father, and has applied for the role of State Vet. However, Danny's attempts to involve Thabo in the first phase of the Lion Breeding Project lead to Du Plessis feeling like an outsider.

programme.title: Wild At Heart: Episode 3
programme.desc: It is Danny's first day as State Vet and when he helps rescue some smuggled animals he feels he's making a difference. However, he discovers the role isn't going to be all plain sailing.

programme.title: Homicide Hunter: Married To The Job

programme.title: Homicide Hunter: Bad Moon Rising

programme.title: Bob the Builder

programme.title: Bob the Builder

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Mr Fothergill has a nasty case of dry rot, so Bob and crew will have to use some smelly chemicals to fix it. As these will affect Mr Fothergill’s allergies, he goes to his sister’s for the day. But she doesn’t get on with Hamish, his pet parrot.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
